basics.name: Md. Masud Rana
basics.label: Bioinformatics Researcher
basics.summary: A dedicated bioinformatics researcher specializing in toxicogenomics, statistical modeling, and biomarker discovery, with expertise in developing novel algorithms and software tools for data analysis.

work.name: National Genomics Data Center, Beijing Institute of Genomics, CAS & CNCB
work.summary: Developed advanced computational models and tools for toxicogenomics and DNA-based facial recognition.
highlights: Developed 'ToxAssay' for biomarker discovery and adverse outcome pathway analysis.
Created 'ALVA' algorithm for prioritizing compound targets in carcinogenesis.
Integrated DNA phenotyping with computer vision for facial recognition.

work.name: University of Rajshahi
work.summary: Conducted statistical modeling for omics data analysis in bioinformatics.
highlights: Developed a robust copula-based statistical model for multi-phenotype GWAS.
Analyzed microbiome data with over-dispersed and zero-inflated models.
Extended hierarchical naïve Bayes model for three-level data classification.

education.institution: National Genomics Data Center, Beijing Institute of Genomics, CAS & CNCB

awards.title: CAS-TWAS President’s Fellowship Programme
awards.awarder: Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS) & The World Academy of Sciences (TWAS)
awards.summary: Awarded for pursuing PhD research in bioinformatics.

awards.title: Third Place in Poster Presentation
awards.summary: Received for a presentation at the International Conference on Biological Sciences.

awards.title: First Place in Statistical Computing Competition
awards.summary: Won for excellence in statistical computing using C++.

publications.name: ToxAssay: A hierarchical model-driven tool for advanced toxicogenomics biomarker discovery
publications.summary: Developed a tool for identifying biomarkers and uncovering molecular mechanisms in toxicogenomics.

publications.name: Prioritizing compound targets by perturbed gene expression using ALVA refines biomarkers in carcinogenesis
publications.summary: Proposed an algorithm for prioritizing targets in carcinogenesis using gene expression data.

projects.name: ToxAssay
projects.summary: Developed a software tool for biomarker discovery and pathway analysis in toxicogenomics.
highlights: Automated data management and post-marker discovery analyses.
Identified key pathways involved in glutathione depletion.

projects.name: ALVA
projects.summary: Designed an algorithm to prioritize compound targets using gene expression data.
highlights: Enhanced safety assessments in carcinogenesis research.

references.name: Dr. Fan Liu
